content: Nevada Overrides Domestic Partner Veto June 1, 2009 The Nevada legislature voted over the weekend to override the gubernatorial veto of a bill that establishes domestic partnerships for same-sex and opposite-sex couples. The law, which grants domestic partners many of the same legal rights and responsibilities as married couples, will take effect on October 1, according to the Las Vegas Review-Journal. The assembly voted 28-14 on Sunday to override the veto by Gov. Jim Gibbons, following a 14-7 vote by the senate on Saturday after an emotional debate. Legislators faced intense lobbying by the tourism industry, which feared a potential boycott by LGBT visitors if the veto were upheld. Full article at ... >>>http://www.advocate.com/news_detail_ektid87475.asp

title: Nevada Overrides Domestic Partner Veto
